IR:

* Iron Raptor had heard Angel Prime�s transmission and she still didn�t like 
it. He was going to be the only one who was going to get them all killed. 
But obviously that didn�t matter to him, so she would leave him to his own 
thoughts and concentrate on those who had come at her call.
She looked towards Prowl at his comments. < That�s just it, I don�t know if 
I�m making the right decisions. >
Iron Raptor�s attention was suddenly grabbed by a familiar voice and she 
turned to see the battered Kluster and some of his crew come up to her from 
the battlefield. He was a commander as well and it confused her slightly 
when he saluted to her, but it was just as well anyway.
Plans to rally the Maximals together so that they were under a single 
command would happen after the battle was over and everything was fixed up.  
There could be too much confusion from having more then one commander.
But with her plans, and the Maximals help, the CF would be repaired in no 
time and then they could get down to business: finding out a way to become 
stronger so that the battles they fought would be theirs even if it wasn�t 
on their own ground like now.
Iron Raptor lifted a brow and showed concern as Proto stumbled towards her. 
They really were beat. And she had a few wounds to show off too!
A few moments later she also noticed Firearm, wondering faintly just where 
Iris was. But she would hear from her soon enough. Besides, she could look 
after herself, even when she was only a view-screen and a voice.
Iron Raptor almost jumped in surprise at FZ�s voice, opening her own comm to 
him. *

� I know, I know. Just give me a sec.�

* This was getting really old really fast.
She looked towards Prowl. < None of them will listen and now the CF might 
get blown up because of it. I think it�s time that what crew we have here 
and myself took the captives and led them out. >
Iron Raptor opened her comm to FZ again. *

� I know I�m in no position to make terms but all I can do now is meet you 
in neutral territory in an hour. Exchange there, then we can both go 
different ways. There�s no way anything can happen here.
But as I said before, leave and the Maximals won�t follow. It�s not their 
nature to when there�s so much to repair. You�ll be left alone then and can 
tend to your own wounded.�

* That was the best she could do right on that moment. It was wise and all 
she could think of.
Fighting would kill them, she already knew that.
Crippled crew and crippled ship wasn�t the way to victory. But she made a 
mental note to step up the CFs defenses when she had the repairs done, even 
if she had to do it on her own.
Iron Raptor stood there and waited, sure that the Maximals behind her 
wouldn�t attack unless she ever had to give the order. But, even though the 
Alliance was threatening, she knew that they were as sick of this fight as 
she was. Or at least hoped.
They had the upper hand here, and fighting only made it worse.*
